item.title: Can ACTUS Stop Financial Crises with Blockchain Data Standards?
item.description:
Can ACTUS Stop Financial Crises with Blockchain Data Standards?

The lack of global financial industry data standards for financial instruments has created chaos for digital currency startups and the financial sector as a whole. Even more devastating is the intensification effect this lack of standards has had during recent financial crises.

item.title: LEOcoin Foundation Releases Full White Paper for New Token
item.description:
LEOcoin Foundation Releases Full White Paper for New Token

The LEOcoin Foundation has released a full white paper for its digital currency, which details development so far as well as outlining a roadmap for future progress. Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services.

item.title: Airbnb hosts: list on OpenBazaar! * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
Airbnb hosts: list on OpenBazaar! * /r/Bitcoin

People around the world are listing their short-term rents on OpenBazaar. Join them! *...

item.title: Mycelium May Roll out P2P Tumbling Soon - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Mycelium May Roll out P2P Tumbling Soon - Bitcoinist.net

There's been no official statements as of yet - but it looks like the Mycelium Wallet will be getting built-in peer-to-peer bitcoin mixing/tumbling later this year. The first testnet transaction from devs went out four days ago, and discussion on internal channels confirms that they're working on integrating P2P tumbling into their popular Android wallet.

item.title: What are the similarities and differences between SWIFT and blockchain?
item.description:
What are the similarities and differences between SWIFT and blockchain?

Answer: None really. Swift is a messaging standard and a blockchain is a database with some more bells and whistles on top.

item.title: Australian Neighborhood Selling Solar Energy with Blockchain Tech - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Australian Neighborhood Selling Solar Energy with Blockchain Tech - Bitcoinist.net

In the National Lifestyle Villages in Busselton, Australia, a group of homes are Also read: Industry Report: Moscow Gets its First Bitcoin Exchange experimenting with selling excess solar energy over the blockchain. The Australian-based start-up, Power Ledger, is conducting the experiment that will last for 8 weeks.

item.title: KNCMiner Has a New Owner: Swedish Entrepreneur to Relaunch Mining Operations
item.description:
KNCMiner Has a New Owner: Swedish Entrepreneur to Relaunch Mining Operations

KNCMiner sold most of its assets following a bankruptcy procedure three months ago, however, it has now been disclosed that a Swedish company called GoGreenligh has received approval to buy most of the mining venture assets.

item.title: Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Bitfinex Gives an Investigation Update - Bitcoin News

Bitfinex has Swiss Capital Zurich Rejects Bitcoin Government revealed more information concerning the investigation of the hack that took place on August 2. The exchange explains the company's initial efforts to identify the hackers and the next steps for the business moving forward. The Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange Bitfinex is back up and operational.

item.title: The importance of security and encryption in the online domain
item.description:
The importance of security and encryption in the online domain

As we move into the digital domain to carry out an ever-growing range of tasks from shopping to playing games like online baccarat, issues of online security and encryption have lost none of their potency.

item.title: BitGo CEO Mike Belshe Believes in Bitcoin Despite Bitfinex Hack
item.description:
BitGo CEO Mike Belshe Believes in Bitcoin Despite Bitfinex Hack

BitGo's Mike Belshe has said that questions raised about the security of bitcoin with some suggesting that digital currencies can never be secure are wrong. After Mt. Gox, the second biggest security breach of a bitcoin exchange took place earlier this month when the Hong Kong-based Bitfinex halted trading after hackers stole around $70 million worth of users' bitcoins.
